unnormalised: For early detection, get a checkup. Regular screenings like mammograms after age 40, say every 12 months or as Dr. Singh advises, are crucial for breast cancer. Also, learn self-examination techniques. If you notice changes, don't delay. Consult an oncologist immediately. Early stage diagnoses often have much better outcomes, with some studies showing survival rates upwards of 90% at stage 1. Remember, early detection can save lives.
normalised: For early detection, get a checkup. Regular screenings like mammograms after age forty, say every twelve months or as Doctor Singh advises, are crucial for breast cancer.
